Reviews.Title: “REALLY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE - overcharge you and do not compensate for employees mistake”
Reviews.Author: npiggles
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 1 night, and got charged the 1 night AND an extra charge of 1024USD,the employee accidently charged my card!! He realised the mistake and refunded the 1024 back into my account. Unfortunately that mistake of himself/and the business resulted in a loss of 60USD for me (due to the exchange rate fluctuation, I live in UK).He offered no compensation.I went there as a customer in good faith,to get slammed with a unwillful charge on my card (its not like I bought something and changed my mind). They accepted no responsibility at all, incredibly unprofessional. I wish there was a tribunal I could contact about this. I spent 2 hours speaking to the owner Albert, to no avail. Him just denying and washing his hands of responsibility. A business ethic like that,doesn't deserve business goodwill. Good luck to those who decide to stay there, but I don't wish it upon anyone. Just a note: No ones fault: Oh and my rental car, got dented by another driver overnight. very squishy car park. Lucky I had insurance.

Reviews.Title: “Totally different property from last year.”
Reviews.Author: rjames868
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a year ago. This year i decided to booked at the Royal Pagoda Motel again. This time, what a surprise. The property has been completely renovated. What a surprise. Rates aren't that much different from last year. However, the property has been totally renovated. A ton more cable t.v. stations. Free internet and free parking. For a downtown location that's really good. I took the DASH bus that is right at the property right to Union Station and was able to Hollywood and Universal Studios. I booked with Booking.com and had no problems with my reservations when I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “NOt well maintained and staff that don't care.”
Reviews.Author: YEthanO
Reviews.Content: To start, its too far from the nearest metro station, the phone didn't even work. my friend said his bed had bedbugs, and the people next door kept us up all night being rude and talking loudly on a cell phone out on the balcony and nothing was done about it. This place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MsJulicious
Reviews.Content: Simply No Good! The cons really outweigh the pros. I should have heeded people's warnings on the net. That same old man was really rude to us. He sounded like he was yelling at me at one point. For whatever reason, the second keycard they gave us was not working and when we went down to the front desk to ask about it, the old man gave us an attitude. Very unprofessional! The room was big enough but old and dingy looking. The bed sheets and blankets had cigarette burns and odd stains. The hardwood floor was nice, at least. Oh, and I did not see any bugs. Location is perfect if you plan on going to Burbank (not too far via the highway) or lots of places in east LA area, like Chinatown (you're right in it!), Lil Tokyo, Downtown, Hollywood, etc. However if you want to go to the west LA area or the beaches, you'll be on the road for a while. And another cool thing is we were right near the festivals and events. We heard and saw bike marathon right outside our window one night, and a few mornings later, we could hear drumming from a Chinese festival happening a few blocks away. Parking is challenging and very squishy. There isn't enough parking spaces, so they squeeze you via parallel-style. Price was $70 or something around there. Should have been lower. It is a motel. There is no security. Some creepy man followed my friend and I to our room! Luckily we locked it quickly but he was knocking a minute after we closed the door. Then 2 minutes later, he was knocking again! Luckily he went away. Put simply, we could have been raped. That was our last night staying there, but I definitely would have found somewhere else to stay after that night!

Reviews.Title: “NO PRIVACY!!!!! RUDE CHINESSE GUY!!”
Reviews.Author: Girlsjustwant2havefu
Reviews.Content: Bad service!!! Rude people!! the chinnese guy was really mean didnt respect privacy came n banging & screaming to the door to move vehicle. He assigned you to parking then he interrupts you to move the vehicle !! & on the other guest rooms if u didnt open the door he would go inside your room theres no PRIVACY!! He was really rude & disrespectful!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not come here!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasjeeper
Reviews.Content: I checked in and put my bags in my room after I left for the day when I returned my room was broken into and most items were missing. I called the police and they informed me they have many complaints about this problem.1/18/11

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: elastin
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay here, but expect the Rits Carlton..or even Holiday Inn. Its priced like a basic motel because thats what it is. However the staff is friendly. Its Chinese owned but they speak good English. Several nice restaurants within walking distance. The bus stop is across the street. Its also relatively clean.

Reviews.Title: “Return Traveller Opinion”
Reviews.Author: TravelL0ver69
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the motel. Every other time has been awesome but this time I did have a few concerns. The first night I went to see the man working as the advertised free wifi wasn't working. He told me it was because of the construction causing the problem. The second night and rest of the week it worked off and on, enough that we were able to check our email and do what needed to be done each day. When we got up the first morning, the water in the shower was warm, not hot so we turned the heater in the room on to get warmed up once out of shower. After the second day, I went and told the management and he sent the house keeping woman to show me how to work the shower...there's only one tap to turn, one way to get hot water so it wasn't an issue of not knowing how to get hot water but I went anyway and tried to explain that although the water doesn't feel cold on your hand, first thing in the morning most people like a hot shower, not luke warm. During our week there, they had the parking lot paved which left only 5 or 6 spots in the lot. When we got back, there was nowhere to park. They had an arrangement already made with a lot across the street to pay our parking there for us, so that was a positive. For me, my biggest concern was the shower. I really appreciate a hot shower in the morning and unfortunately even after bringing it to their attention, I didn't get that privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean room at a cheap price!”
Reviews.Author: TamiLovesToCamp
Reviews.Content: We searched online for a decent place to stay close to dodger stadium. This place is about a mile away. The room was spacious and VERY clean. Loved the wood floors. It was very quiet at night. Only complaint is parking is very limited. Well worth the price,, great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Really cheap for LA but not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: ccgirl05
Reviews.Content: Really cheap for LA but not worth it. Motel is located on the far adge of China town (takes an hour to get to the city center). There is only one person on staff at a time and they speak very poor English. Rooms were renovated (hotel is still under construction) but have not been cleaned properly since. There was hair all over the room (floors, bathroom, even in the bed). There were stains on the bed spread (clearly had not been washed) and when I requested a new set he told me I would need to get the sheets from the lobby and do it myself. Spend the extra money and don't stay here. You will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: RKB08
Reviews.Content: This motel is a great value – at $54 for two people, the price can't be beat. Rooms were bigger than expected, and very clean. Bathroom was clean, if a little dingy (grout could use some bleach). There were lots of restaurants within walking distance. Service was okay, not super friendly but fine. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Los Angeles Chinatown!”
Reviews.Author: underonegroove
Reviews.Content: I spent a Friday and Saturday night at this motel. Don't let the size of the motel fool you! My room was huge. The sleeping area and bathroom were clean and stocked. They even had a full size refrigerator. Amazing! I enjoyed the service and people so much I stayed there the following Friday and Saturday. Stop by!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and neat.”
Reviews.Author: eve415
Reviews.Content: I don't know what "kelfunk" from New York was talking about. There definetly were no bed bugs when I stood there. I'm usually very iffy about the bedding as well. I mean I've unfortunetly stood in pretty sleazy, smelly. smells-like- someone-just-had-sex-right- before- you-stepped-into-the-room, type or rooms, and this was nothing like that. It was neat, clean, had nice hard-wood flooring. Rug is dirtier. And there wasn't no gross out porn to greet you when you turned on the t.v.. Its wasn't no Ritz, but it was decent as far as motels go. The price was a bit high but ok if your going halfs on a room with someone. Plus its in Chinatown so theres lots to see and explore. I'm a local but I would definetly stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: kelfunk
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience. Yes, there is free parking and wireless. But the hotel room is DIRTY. There were bed bugs in our bed, hair in the bathroom, and a dirty floor. Area is safe, so if you don't mind having bugs crawl on u in bed, yes, I would recommend u stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Really sweet place.”
Reviews.Author: JPGGP
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised at how nice this motel was considerring how cheap it was compared to many others in LA. The rooms were really nice, clean and quiet. Good size, with cable tv, fridge and walk in wardrobe. The location was good so long as you don't go wondering the streets at night, China Town is pretty dead after dark. The metro station is really close so its got good links to Hollywood, Pasadena etc. Downtown go metro bus stops right outside. All in all I had a great stay, and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: mapocock5
Reviews.Content: Room: - Pros: The room was large, clean and well eqipped with a decent size bathroom. Cons: Very noisey air conditioning, one lamp didn't work, only a few English channels on TV, phone only for incoming calls Staff: Only saw the reception man and manager who all speak very loud to you like they are shouting Facilities: Free Parking though limited and free wi-fi. Plus coffee in reception 24/7 Located just a few minutes walk to the Metro. Didn't feel unsafe walking at night around there. Overall: A pleasant stay in a clean room at a good price

Reviews.Title: “only for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: boszibaba
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny little but it had everything and it was clean. It was a good access to the attractions in los angeles. The surrounding is kind of dirty and i wouldn't walk alone in the night, but during the day it is nice. It was very interesting for us because we got to look in the chinese culture. There is no breakfast but there is coffee and tea all day.

Reviews.Title: “basic but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: pgwodeshed
Reviews.Content: For the price ($55/night including tax) we got a room with two double beds, nicely appointed furniture, small bath, and classy-looking bamboo flooring. The staff was great--very helpful. There was always enough--just enough--parking. 10-15 minute drive to USC and clkose to public transit. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: age411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the heart of China town which is a pretty good location. Its close to Hollywood, Sunset Strip, Mulholland Drive, and Rodeo Drive. We were looking for a decent hotel for a smart price with free parking and internet and we got just that but were pleasantly surprised at how nice the rooms were. The rooms were recently renovated, very spacious, and very clean. There was a hairdryer in the room as well as a fridge. The service was entertaining to say the least. The guys spoke broken English so they were funny. I had to beg for extra pillows though since it was late but I eventually got them. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean Motel in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: pralin
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic, inexpensive motel in Chinatown. Convenient to major highways. The parking was tight, but we always got a spot when we came back. The free high speed internet was always reliable. Within walking distance to great Chinese food. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgerfan Motel”
Reviews.Author: Robocopms
Reviews.Content: The Royal Pagoda is a Motel - don't expect a 4 star hotel - it is not in that class. What it is, is a comfortable place that is perfect after a Dodger game (approx $5 cab ride from Dodger stadium). The rooms are standard but spacious and clean with a mini fridge and decent size TV. The 'Chinatown' stop on the much underrated Metro (Gold line) is 5 min walk away and a plethora of good Chinese restaurants are also in spitting distance. The young lad at reception was very helpful - called a cab and recommended a very good restaurant for dinner. Much appreciated. I would recommend the Royal Pagoda for a night after a Dodger game or as a LA base for a extended stay for a backpacker/budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like the Royal Pagoda”
Reviews.Author: tinrie
Reviews.Content: I did not like this motel at all. It was really small, smelled bad ,and the sheets were dirty. The staff service was below average, the area was not ok, and the parking uuuugggghhhh we had so much trouble getting in and out of there because of the small space i damaged my car . the only good thing about the place is that it was super cheap all i have to say is that i would never stay here again unless i was really desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain Motel”
Reviews.Author: garrett678
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of Chinatown of LA, this motel offers the basic amenities, along with FREE parking (a rarity in LA). It is affordable and convenient to all the tourist sites. Buses run along the street that it is on and a train station is only 3-4 blocks away. Plenty of Chinese restaurants line the streets and is only a short stroll away. The rooms are a bit old but spacious. They are acceptable for the price. The area is quiet at night as most shops close and few pedestrians are around, so be careful at night. Otherwise a good experience for me and my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, free wireless, funny staff and safe”
Reviews.Author: John-family
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ: We used this hotel for 9 days. We were on a cheap Church mission so needed cheap and safe accomodation. O.k, this is not a marriot or 5star but it is convinient. Free parking Clean Towels TV in room Air Con/Heating (a little noisy) Tea and Coffee in reception Vending Machines Soap etc in bathrooms Nice big mirror in bathroom (small bathroom) Double beds (sheets and blankets are ok) Plenty of powerpoints Fridge Table in room The photos are as stated and we got what we saw on the photos Close to chinese resturants where rush hour was filmed (be sure to look for the 'A' rating on the resturants window. 'A' is good- 'C' is bad) Not far from burger king and downtown also dodger stadium. 4miles from hollywood (broadway onto the sunset blv and you are there) Any other details, feel free to ask (midas_11@hotmail.com) Im back again next year and would defo be re-booking with this hotel Stacey John

Reviews.Title: “Good budget L.A. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DowntownSteve
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews of this place I was a little sceptical. But I have to say overall this was a pretty decent hotel for the location and price. Royal Pagoda is in the heart of Chinatown and a short 2 block walk to the Metro transit system. The room was clean, and had been remodeled somewhat recently with laminate wood flooring and corian type counter tops in the bathroom. As other reviewers have mentioned, the bathroom is very small, and the counter space is minimal, but the shower is fairly large. It gets the job done. A tight fit for sure though. The Exterior is well maintained with a traditional Chinese design, the room has minimal Chinese decor, basic room. Sure, there are some dings in the room, one wall in the bathroom could use a paint job, overall the room was in pretty decent shape. Parking is tight, but is free...a rairity in the city. Most places will charge an additional $10-$20 per night. We arrived at the hotel at around 1 a.m. and had a space ready for us. The beds were firm and comfy. Standard sheets and comforter...no 400 thred count sheets here which is understandable for the price.. I can understand some people having a problem with street noise as this hotel is on a corner and there is a bus stop on one side of the hotel. Super light sleepers should be aware. The windows are double pane and does block some of the noise. Leaving the fan on from the A/C helps wash out some of the street noise too. The staff was courteous, though when we asked for ice for our small cooler they were a little stingy with that, but we got what we needed. The color TV worked fine, stations availavle in English, Spanish, and Chinese. I didn't count, but there are probably 30-40 different channels to choose from. I have been to L.A. several times, and to find a place in the city for under a hundred dollars a night is tough, unless it's a fleabag or in ghetto area. This is no 5 star hotel nor is it a dump. It's a great, no frills place to crash, and still in the heart of Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Deal with great location”
Reviews.Author: dezaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the fourth of july weekend. Our plans included Shopping in dowtown LA, Santa Monica, Hollywood and Universal Studios. Everything was a 10-15 minute drive down an easily accessible freeway. The rooms were excellent. Our room had a tiled entry hallway, closet at the entrance with wooden hangers, two nice beds with new looking sheets. It wasn't the best in comfort but I still had a great sleep. The floors in the room were wood/possibly laminate wood, looked very new. We had a small fridge and small TV. Plenty of drawer space. The restrooms were small but clean. The only unfortunate thing was the sink was in with the shower, so getting ready included a lot of courtesy knocks. Four girls stayed for two nights and would DEFINITELY most ABSOLUTELY book here again. The location was perfect. We felt pretty safe considering we were in the heart of LA. The only thing we didn't like (and this was our problem not the hotels) was on our way home from the fashion district we took back roads instead of a freeway to get home. At 6 at night we drove through old apartments and shelters. Lots of homeless people walking around, including a woman in her underwear and jacket :0 But once we got into chinatown we felt safe again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelL0ver69
Reviews.Content: Went to LA with my sister on vacation. We were looking for a cheap, clean, safe place to lay our heads at night. This motel is right in the center of Chinatown, 5 minute walk to the big market where there are some really good bargains. Only a dozen or so parking places but it's free and the management make sure that only paying customers park there. They are even mindful of the way people park to be certain they are not using two spaces. Very friendly staff. Use of microwave, free coffee and tea anytime, and fridge in room. Hairdryer available upon request, you pay a $10.00 deposit and it is returned when the hairdryer is returned. TV with remote control and many diferent channels. Usually quiet at night, although it is on a main road so we sometimes heard the traffic a little. Clean towels daily. Huge closet to put all the things you buy! Planning another trip next year and will return there.

Reviews.Title: “First Choice”
Reviews.Author: BuddyCha
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Royal Pagoda every year, sometimes more often, since May 1988! It is not a taxi ride from Chinatown; it IS in Chinatown. This part of L.A. has improved a lot since 1988. The Pagoda has improved a lot since its renovation. Be advised that the cleaning ladies are mostly elderly and work very hard. I've only had one worry ever, and that was concerning parking. If I were there at a busy time and came back late, I stressed a bit over finding a space. The lot is small. Also, if you have a big vehicle, take care when backing out of your space. Room doors are right there before you've backed the length of your vehicle. Not to be effusive, but I love the Royal Pagoda.

Reviews.Title: “really fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amtraktraveler
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a fun weekend in Los Angeles and stumbled across this property. They were actually filming an ESPN commerical on the property when I arrived. The property is in the middle of Chinatown. There is this public transportation located right at the proeprty called DASH. For 25 cents you can take this bus all over downtown and to the train station which is how i travel. From the train station you can take the Metro to Hollywood and Universal Studios. There were plenty of restaurants, shopping all within walking distance. This is a budget property, the rooms are small but clean and the area is really safe. The staff is friendly. I will stay again the next time I visit Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel very safe here”
Reviews.Author: Helen25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, but this really is low budget accommodation. The doors to the rooms are thin - leaving you feel a little vunerable. Some rooms have been renovated - replaced the carpet for wooden floor, bathroom very small - with sink, toilet and shower. Sort of place where you don't want to walk on the carpet without shoes on! Sheets were strangely coloured yellow and the rooms were not particularly sound proof! Not alot to do in the area, so make sure you have a car. You get what you pay for her - cheap price, cheap accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money and great location”
Reviews.Author: FrugalButPicky
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler in L.A. 3 nights/wk & had opportunity to stay in a number of different rooms in Royal Pagoda Motel. It's usually a great deal given that the location in Chinatown near downtown L.A. usually costs one much more for similar rooms (prices via Hotels.com, etc., vary, of course). Overall, rooms and bed linens are clean, though I did have one room with a few minor carpet stains and some walls could use a fresh coat of paint, but that's not a concern, and they seem to keep things in good order. Guests seem to be mostly budget-minded Asian tourists and there have been no noisy partying types, at least on the weeknights I've been there. If you're after a clean, quiet, safe place to stay that's about a 20 minute walk or a short bus (DASH) ride from Amtrak - Union Station or downtown L.A., this is your place. For 25 cents, the DASH bus, Line "B", runs every 5-10 minutes until about 6:45 PM, loops through Chinatown with a stop right at the corner of the motel, and also loops though downtown L.A. Motel Management has been courtious and attentive, and they seem to run a tight ship. It meets my needs, and I'll continue to use it as-needed. Also, there are plenty of good Chinese restaurants in area, but do try "Ru Chun" at 937 N. Hill St., just a couple blocks from Royal Pagoda.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It!”
Reviews.Author: msjaycee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this motel this past Monday night. We're both military and used to "roughing it". And that's exactly what we thought we'd be doing when we booked this motel. It was under $55.00. But we were WRONG! While this place isn't luxury, it's worth more than the 1 star rating that it gets. Our room was very clean and neat. The guy at the front desk didn't speak English very well, but he was still very nice. The room included a refrigerator but no microwave. We went downstairs to see if we could use the one down there. Not only did the guy at the front desk heat our food up for us, but called our room when it was ready. The location is in Chinatown where you can get some really tasty Chinese food. Everyone says the location is dangerous, but we went out at about 2230 to walk to get something to eat and felt totally safe. I'm always aware of my surroundings and never let my guard down though. The other plus was that the freeway was easily accessible. I guess the only negative thing I would have to say was the television didn't work properly. We couldn't change the channel, so we had to watch HBO the entire night . lol. If you're looking for luxury in LA, then this isn't the place for you. But if you need a cheap, clean place to lay your head while you're in LA, this is definitely the place for you. I'll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Dump”
Reviews.Author: traintraveler303
Reviews.Content: The Royal Pagoda Motel was quoted by Hotels.com as being just across the street from the Los Angeles Union Train Station (within walking distance). BEWARE! It is a 10 minute taxi ride into the Chinatown part of LA. The door to the room would barely lock - a big security concern. The room was dingy, light switches had built-up grime. The sheets were old and had visible holes in them. Additionally, the sheets looked as if they had been used and not changed as we found "suspect hairs" in the sheets. There was also some questionable activity going on within the motel premises. While in our room, we heard a man pounding on another room door after 11:00PM demanding his $50.00. Lastly, we were told by the Hotels.com booking agent that this motel provided a continental breakfast. I guess if you consider a cup of coffee as breakfast, it applies. Yes, the motel is cheap, but we suggest staying at your own risk

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Pagoda Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 995 N Broadway, Los Angeles, CA 90012
